node.title: Cold Weather blowing in – Update: Friday 30 January; 6.30am
node.Body:
Weather Forecast

Last night was very quiet with no snow. Some bands of sleet passed across the area but caused no problems. The Met Office forecast indicates that the wintery weather will continue, however today (Friday) conditions will generally dry out.  Temperatures remain low so drivers should take care.

Gritting

The gritting team completed a full gritting run yesterday afternoon and are on call in the unlikely event that conditions will change.

Based on the current Met Office forecast we don’t expect the weather to cause any problems and we expect all roads and schools to continue to be open and operating normally. The Council’s salt barn was fully restocked last week and our gritting operations from yesterday have ensured there is good bed of salt on our roads. We will be monitoring the conditions and carrying out further inspections

Waste Collection Preparations

We anticipate that household waste will be collected normally. Households are being asked to put their waste out on their scheduled collection day.

Schools

All schools are expected to be open and operating normally. For the latest information on local schools please go to  www.bathnes.gov.uk/school-closures.

Highways Preparations

The Highways team will have inspectors out on the roads to monitor conditions. The timing of any further gritting runs will be dependent on prevailing conditions to maximise the effectiveness of the gritting process.

Car parks

All car parks are expected to be open.

Other Council Services

All other Council services are anticipated to be open and operating normally. The Council’s website will be updated regularly to keep residents up to date about general information: www.bathnes.gov.uk .

Any problems should reported either via the online form www.bathnes.gov.uk/reportit or to Council Connect on 01225 394041.

Winter driving tips

The Council has put together some useful winter driving hints and tips to help you ensure your journey is safe in snow/icy conditions.
